io.artframework

Interface Requirement<TTarget>

  • Type Parameters:
    TTarget - target type this requirement applies too. Defines the filtering scope.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ArtObject, ResultCreator
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericRequirement, RequirementContext<TTarget>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountRequirement, DefaultRequirementContext
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Requirement<TTarget>
extends ArtObject, ResultCreator
    A Requirement can be used to filter Actions, Trigger or be used inside other plugins for filtering.

    Register your requirements by calling ART#register(). This will wrap the Requirement into a RequirementContext and bundle it with the configured options.

    A requirement will only be used for filtering if the target type matches with the object that is being filtered.

    For example: an Action that is targeting players can only be filtered by requirements that also target players.

    See Also:
    Context, Action, Trigger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result test(@NonNull Target<TTarget> target, @NonNull ExecutionContext<RequirementContext<TTarget>> context)
      Tests if this requirement should filter Actions or Triggers for the given target.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.artframework.ResultCreator

        cancelled, empty, error, error, failure, resultOf, resultOf, success

    • Method Detail

      • test

        Result test(@NonNull
            @NonNull Target<TTarget> target,
            @NonNull
            @NonNull ExecutionContext<RequirementContext<TTarget>> context)
        Tests if this requirement should filter Actions or Triggers for the given target. Return true for the check to pass and not to filter out the action. Return false if the check fails and the actions should be filtered.
        Parameters:
        target - the target that is checked in this requirement
        context - the context that holds the config and context of the check
        Returns:
        false if the check fails and the filter should be applied or true if all checks pass and no filtering should be applied.
